entrance text.statement: You are in the first room of the new, data-driven world we are creating in an attempt to be a halfway intelligent human.

town square.name: the town square
town square.look: The town square, full of people and activities.

entrance text.statement: You are in the Delran town square, which is bustling with activity. It's autumn, and the weekends are always like this -- people traveling to the blacksmith or the cobbler's, or rushing over to the dairy to try to get the last of the week's butter. The sun is out, there are leaves on the ground, and all seems well.

changes.statement:
You walk casually into the town square. The sky darkens.
	SOMETHING IS AMISS.
	You start looking around at the same time everyone else seems to get a feeling of unease. Suddenly, the clatter of ironclad horse hooves floods the square, and five cloaked riders burst in throught he arches at the front of town, holding long swords with thick, studded gloves. Two head straight for the Donutorium.
	Three stay behind, blocking the factory gates and preventing anyone from coming or going from the square. One wears a blue cloak, another green, and the third is in black, with extra armor. All have long cavalry swords.
	The black-robed rider, positioned in front of the Donutorium gates, removes his hood and speaks.
	"Too long has Delran taken its donut success for granted," he says. "As we speak, our colleagues are dismantling your factory. You may be able to repair the machines, but you will never see your glaze crystal again."
	Everyone stands perfectly still, spread out all over the square. A teenaged girl stands next to you, fidgeting with the sides of her cloak.
The old wooden gates of the Delran Donutorium, hanging broken after the invasion by the dark riders.
The front door of the donutorium is boarded up. No one has gone in or out since the invasion.

cider brewery front.name: the front of the cider brewery
cider brewery front.look: The best damn apple cider plant in the land.

entrance text.statement: The cider brewery, housed in what used to be the biggest barn in town. Now significantly larger (and noisier), but you can still see where the original building was worked into the larger design.

cider brewery.name: the cider brewery
cider brewery.look: The front door of the Cider Brewery. Predictably, everything here smells like apples.

entrance text.statement: The old Delran Cider Brewery, the second-largest culinary outfit in town. You can hear the workers yelling apple-related things at each other just behind a large door. A young man sits at a desk in the lobby.

drury lane front.name: the entrance to Drury Lane
drury lane front.look: The entrance to quaint, quiet Drury Lane, actually a court because it doesn't go anywhere. Trees line the streets, in between gaslamps along thin sidewalks.

entrance text.statement: You turn and walk down Drury Lane, the street on which you grew up. It's one of the few streets in town without wagon ruts worn in the middle, as most of the other streets have a mix of businesses and homes. Drury, however, has only a few houses, to the south.

drury lane.name: Drury Lane
drury lane.look: Drury Lane, the same old street you grew up on. As a kid, you were bored out of your mind on this dead-end, but now you can appreciate its peaceful atmosphere and unassuming construction.

entrance text.statement: You're on Drury Lane.

donutorium gates.name: the Donutorium gates
donutorium gates.look: The gates of the town donutorium, the most famous donut factory in all the land.

entrance text.statement: You are at the front gates of the illustrious Delran Donutorium. No better donut has ever been made than the one that comes out of this place hundreds of times a day.

donutorium front.name: the front door of the Donutorium
donutorium front.look: The front door of the Donutorium, behind the short wooden fence that's clearly there more for decoration than security.

entrance text.statement: The elaborately carved front door of the Delran Donutorium.

donutorium.name: the lobby of the Donutorium
donutorium.look: The window next to the door is small, so you can't see much. The lobby is definitely large, and you can see the outlines of what must be people moving around.

entrance text.statement: You push open the door to the Donutorium, revealing the beautiful foyer and donut shop that's been run out of the building since the business started so long ago. People are pushing carts of donuts back and forth, clipboards are passed between busy workers. A clerk stands behind the donut counter.

parents house front.name: your parents' porch
parents house front.look: The front door of your parent's house -- a small, two-story bungalow with a pointy roof and window boxes full of flowers and herbs.

entrance text.statement: You are on your parents' porch.

default.descriptor: A large pumpkin sits by the door.

smash.descriptor: The gloppy remains of a smashed-up old pumpkin sit by the door.

from.default: You lift the pumpkin high over your head and slam it back down on the porch. It crumbles into little pumpkin chunklets.

parents house.name: your parents' house
parents house.look: You can't see through the door, but can hear someone bustling around inside.

entrance text.statement: You walk through the door and into your childhood home, almost totally unchanged. It's cleaner now that there aren't kids running around banging on everything, but the decorations are safe and familiar.

default.descriptor:
Your mom hugs you tightly. 
	"Welcome home, dear," she says. "Have a cookie!"

take.descriptor: Your mom is bustling around the house, doing random spring cleaning.

from.default:
You take the cookie and put it in your pack. 
	"Thanks, Mom," you say, "I'm sure this will come in handy soon."

entrance text.statement: You are standing in front of the town's 15-foot iron gates, holdovers of a more violent age. They've collected so much rust since the last time they were closed that they're probably stuck open forever.

woods0.name: the edge of the Hecate Forest
woods0.look: The line of trees separating Delran from the vast forest beyond.

entrance text.statement: You're at the western terminus of the long, winding trail through the Hecate Forest.

woods1.name: the trail leading into the Hecate forest
woods1.look: A small gravel trail, leading deep into the forest.

entrance text.statement: You're in the woods.

woods2.name: more trail, through a thick part of the forest
woods2.look: A patch of trail like any other.

entrance text.statement: You're in the woods. The trees here are so thick that you can only see a few yards off of the path before everything is obscured by leaves.

woods3.name: more of the Hecate Forest trail
woods3.look: A patch of trail like any other.

entrance text.statement: You're in the woods, walking along the winding main trail through the Hecate.

woods4.name: more of the Hecate Forest trail
woods4.look: A patch of trail like any other.

entrance text.statement: You're in the woods, walking along the winding main trail through the Hecate.

hermits path.name: a tiny, overgrown path, leading through the trees
hermits path.look: You can't really tell where it goes, but a small offshoot of the trail meanders off and down a small hill.

entrance text.statement: You push aside some branches and step cautiously down the path, which is strewn with loose rocks and brambles. Someone cleared this path once, but it was long ago.

hermits house front.name: the front porch of a broken-down shack
hermits house front.look: A squat, one-story shack that looks like it may have at one time been quite nice -- that time, however, is certainly not now.

entrance text.statement: You emerge from the small path and walk up onto the rotting porch of the shack. There are hints of a former home here -- glass windows, what might be the remnants of a swing set -- but now, nature is reclaiming the land. Ivy coveres the walls, and a large branch crashed through the roof at some point during the house's many years of disrepair.

hermits foyer.name: the inside of the shack
hermits foyer.look: Peering in a window, you see only darkness. What little light the trees let through the canopy, the roof is blocking from inside.

entrance text.statement: You push your way into the house's decrepit foyer, which is dusty, dark, and suspiciously well-organized: mail sits on a small table by the door, photographs are hanging straight on the walls, and a bookshelf is full of alphabetized (but very dirty) tomes.

mail.statement: There are four unopened envelopes sitting on the table, postmarked years and years ago. The name on them is "Louis Turner" -- but the address is your parents'.

hermits farm.name: a small garden, hidden in the weeds
hermits farm.look: The side yard is full of weeds, but there also seem to be some vegetables mixed in.

entrance text.statement: You push through the rickety side door and into the garden -- it's as overgrown as the rest of the place, but somebody's tended to the area enough that there's room for some plants that are actually edible.

default.descriptor: A cucumber sits in the dirt.
A tomato sits in the dirt.
A squash sits in the dirt.

hermits hallway.name: a small, dark hallway
hermits hallway.look: A skinny hallway with a single door at the end.

default.descriptor: You can't see very well, but there's an old photo hanging on the wall. There are five people in it: an old, old man, two children (a girl and a boy), a middle-aged woman, and a young man, about 20 years old.

hermits bedroom.name: another room behind a small door
hermits bedroom.look: The door is closed; you can't see anything but a sliver of sunlight escaping from under the door.

entrance text.statement: You cautiously open the door; its hinges creak and shudder, pulling against years of grit and dust. You discover the door leads to a small bedroom -- the twin-size bed is made neatly with sun-faded blankets.

default.descriptor: A small purple book sits on the pillowcase.

from.default:
You pick up the book and open it gently -- the spine and back cover make a quiet cracking sound... no one's opened this for a long time.
	You turn a few pages and glance at the words. It seems like some kind of nursery rhyme. Then, however, you turn another page -- and reveal a hidden compartment, carved into the middle of the book. Inside the tiny rectangle is a small metal key.
from.inspect:
You pick up the book and open it gently -- the spine and back cover make a quiet cracking sound... no one's opened this for a long time.
	You turn a few pages and glance at the words. It seems like some kind of nursery rhyme. Then, however, you turn another page -- and reveal a hidden compartment, carved into the middle of the book. Inside the tiny rectangle is a small metal key.
A creaky old book with a tidy little hiding spot inside.

disallowed states.take: You pick up the book to toss it in your pack, but something seems strange about it. It's lighter than it should be...

woods5.name: more of the Hecate Forest trail
woods5.look: A patch of trail like any other.

entrance text.statement: You're in the woods, walking along the winding main trail through the Hecate.

woods6.name: a curve in the trail
woods6.look: A patch of trail like any other, this one turning sharply north.

entrance text.statement: You're in the woods, walking along the winding main trail through the Hecate.

woods7.look: A patch of trail like any other.

woods8.look: A patch of trail like any other.
